I have just realised there is no park break available (or if you have found it, please indicate it to me), which is quite a no-go for any kind of serious rover 

One of the result can be your rover finishing in a lake:
Um, the action group box on the left?
Ah indeed, here it is !
there should be a keystroke for Parking Break in KSP2, like [CTRL] + ... Really need this!

I think the problem may be that the "parking break" will not stay set. For example, with a Kerbal driving your rover you set the break, then the Kerbal goes EVA from the rover, and the rover's break is no longer set...

B is the brakes.

Also the little hand symbol on the left of the screen.

Sometimes with Rovers - if you get out... you have to put down landing legs to keep the rover from rolling away.
